greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = largest k which satisfies n = k + bitcount(k), or 0 if no such k exists. Here bitcount(k) (A000120) gives the number of 1's in binary representation of nonnegative integer k.
comment: A083058(n)+1 gives a lower bound for nonzero terms, n-1 an upper bound.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8192
Index entries for Colombian or self numbers and related sequences
program: (Scheme) (define (A228087 n) (let loop ((k n)) (cond ((<= k (A083058 n)) 0) ((= n (A092391 k)) k) (else (loop (- k 1))))))
xref: Cf. A228086, A228085. A010061 gives the positions of zeros after a(0). The union of A010061 and A228088 gives the positions where a(n) = A228086(n).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 09 2013
